class_description:
You typically use instances of NSUnitMass to represent specific quantities of mass using the NSMeasurement class.
Mass is a fundamental property of matter that causes it to resist being accelerated by a force. The SI unit for mass is the kilogram (kg), which defined in terms of the mass of the international prototype kilogram.
The NSUnitMass class defines its base unit as kilograms, and provides the following units, which are initialized using UnitConverterLinear converters with the specified coefficients:
